sentences: What is earthquake?
Define earthquake.
What do you know about earthquake?
Can you tell about earthquake?
Can you provide information about earthquakes?
responses: An earthquake (also known as a quake, tremor or temblor) is the shaking of the surface of the Earth, resulting from the sudden release of energy in the Earth's lithosphere that creates seismic waves.

sentences: What is tsunami?
Define tsunami.
What do you know about tsunami?
Can you tell about tsunami?
Can you provide information about tsunami?
responses: A tsunami or tidal wave, also known as a seismic sea wave, is a series of waves in a water body caused by the displacement of a large volume of water, generally in an ocean or a large lake.

sentences: What will cause tsunami?
How did the tsunami happen?
How does tsunami occur?
What are the reasons for occur the tsunami?
responses: Tsunami are actually waves caused by sudden movement of the ocean due to earthquakes, landslides on the sea floor, land slumping into the ocean, major volcanic eruptions or large meteorite impacts. The top of an underwater volcano may collapse downwards, so that the overlying water also drops.

sentences: What are seismic_waves?
Define a seismic wave.
What do you know about seismic waves?
Can you tell about seismic waves?
Can you provide information about seismic waves?
responses: Seismic waves are the waves of energy caused by the sudden breaking of rock within the earth or an explosion. They are the energy that travels through the earth and is recorded on seismographs.

sentences: What is USGS?

responses: The United States Geological Survey is a scientific agency of the United States government. The scientists of the USGS study the landscape of the United States, its natural resources, and the natural hazards that threaten it. For more details https://earthquake.usgs.gov/

sentences: How a tsunami is caused?
How tsnami's occour
What causes Tsunami?
What is the reason for occurance of tsunami?
responses: A tsunami is a series of large waves generated by an abrupt movement on the ocean floor that can result from an earthquake, an underwater landslide, a volcanic eruption or - very rarely - a large meteorite strike. However, powerful undersea earthquakes are responsible for most tsunamis.

sentences: What is the largest earthquake occured?
Tell me the details of largest earthquake occured in the world?
Can you provide me the details of largest earthquake details
Where is the largest earthquake occured?
When is the largest earthquake occured?
What was the worst earthquake ever?
responses: The world's largest earthquake with an instrumentally documented magnitude occurred on May 22, 1960 near Valdivia, in southern Chile. It was assigned a magnitude of 9.5 by the United States Geological Survey. It is referred to as the 'Great Chilean Earthquake' and the '1960 Valdivia Earthquake'.

sentences: which country has the most earthquakes in the world?
which country suffered more earthquakes?
Which country are more prone to earthquakes.?
responses: Indonesia is in a very active seismic zone, also, but by virtue of its larger size than Japan, it has more total earthquakes. Which country has the most earthquakes per unit area? This would probably be Tonga, Fiji, or Indonesia since they are all in extremely active seismic areas along subduction zones.

sentences: which state in the US has the most earthquakes?
which state in the United Status has the most earthquakes?
which state suffered more earthquakes in US?
responses: Each year the southern California area has about 10,000 earthquakes. Most of them are so small that they are not felt. Only several hundred are greater than magnitude 3.0, and only about 15-20 are greater than magnitude 4.0. If there is a large earthquake, however, the aftershock sequence will produce many more earthquakes of all magnitudes for many months.

sentences: In which season does the earthquake occour more frequently?
Is there any relation between weather and earthquakes?
responses: As far as we know, there is no such thing as 'earthquake weather'. Statistically, there is an equal distribution of earthquakes in cold weather, hot weather, rainy weather, etc. If weather does affect earthquake occurrence, we do not yet understand how it works.

sentences: which place has less earthquakes in the world?
List the places doen't affect by earthquakes
responses: From 1975-1995 there were only four states that did not have any earthquakes. They were: Florida, Iowa, North Dakota, and Wisconsin.

sentences: what is the deepest earthquake ever recorded?
What has been the deepest earthquake?
responses: The massive, magnitude-8.3 temblor that struck today (May 24) near Russia's Kamchatka Peninsula could turn out be the deepest earthquake ever recorded. At 378 miles (609 kilometers) below the seafloor, the quake could best the previous record set in Bolivia, in 1994

sentences: What is the most destructive earthquake in the world?
What is the most disaster of earthquake?
responses: The Great San Francisco Earthquake caused $524 million in damage and killed 3,000 people. Every year, earthquakes cause thousands of deaths, either directly or due to the resulting tsunamis, landslides, fires, and famines.

sentences: how many earthquakes can happen in a day?
Possible number of earthquakes in a day?
how many earthquakes will occour in a a day?
how many earthquakes can be felt in a day?
responses: On average, Magnitude 2 and smaller earthquakes occur several hundred times a day world wide. Major earthquakes, greater than magnitude 7, happen more than once per month. 'Great earthquakes', magnitude 8 and higher, occur about once a year.

sentences: What is the longest earthquake on record?
where is the longest earthquake occured?
What is the highest duration of earthquake?
Which earthquake lasted the longest?
How long did the Sumatra earthquake last for?
responses: Dec. 2004 Sumatra quake was longest ever recorded. According to new information about the earthquake of December 26, 2004, it was the longest-lasting earthquake ever recorded.Indonesia, Sri Lanka, India, and Thailand were hardest hit. With a magnitude of between 9.1 and 9.3, it is the second largest earthquake ever recorded on a seismograph. This earthquake had the longest duration of faulting ever observed, between 8.3 and 10 minutes.

sentences: how many earthquakes can happen in a year?
Possible number of earthquakes in a year?
how many earthquakes will occur in a a year?
how many earthquakes can be felt each year?
responses: It is estimated that there are 500,000 detectable earthquakes in the world each year. 100,000 of those can be felt, and 100 of them cause damage. It is thought that more damage was done by the resulting fire after the 1906 San Francisco earthquake than by the earthquake itself.

sentences: what earthquake happened in 2004?
give some details about sumatra earthquake?
give some details about indonesia earthquake?
responses: The 2004 Indian Ocean earthquake occurred at 00:58:53 UTC on 26 December with the epicentre off the west coast of Sumatra, Indonesia. The shock had a moment magnitude of 9.1–9.3 and a maximum Mercalli intensity of IX (Violent).

sentences: What is the largest tsunami ever recorded?
give some details about largest tsunami?
can you give some details about highest tsunami?
responses: An earthquake followed by a landslide in 1958 in Alaska's Lituya Bay generated a wave 100 feet high, the tallest tsunami ever documented. When the wave ran ashore, it snapped trees 1,700 feet upslope.

sentences: When was the last tsunami and where was it?
where does the tsunami occoured recently?
Can you tell me the recently occurred tsunami?
responses: 16 September 2015 (UTC), Mw 8.3, Off Illapel, Chile Tsunami. The 16 September 2015 magnitude 8.3 Off Illapel, Chile earthquake (31.570°S, 71.654°W, depth 25 km) occurred at 2255 UTC and generated a tsunami that was observed all over the Pacific region and caused damage locally.

sentences: What is the deadliest tsunami in recorded history?
when was the worlds largest tsunami occured?
Can you tell me the worlds largest tsunami?
which tsunami was the most destructive
responses: “It still affects me most days,” Dec. 26, 2004, Indian Ocean Tsunami survivor Dwayne Meadows said. The 2004 Indian Ocean Tsunami is the deadliest tsunami in recorded history, and it caused an estimated $14 billion in damages at the time

sentences: How fast can a tsunami can go?
How fast does the tsunami can move?
what is the speed of the tsunami?
responses: Where the ocean is over 6,000 meters (3.7 miles) deep, unnoticed tsunami waves can travel at the speed of a commercial jet plane, over 800 km per hour (500 miles per hour). Tsunamis travel much slower in shallower coastal waters where their wave heights begin to increase dramatically.
